p: In support of this pathway, studies showed a significant heterogeneity in the range of estimates for the presence of SARS-CoV-2 RNA in blood, from 0% in numerous studies [ 84], and even up to 76% in a critical care setting. Pooled data estimated that SARS-CoV-2 RNA may be detected at low copy numbers in about 10% of blood samples from patients with COVID-19 [ 84].
